sqlite_primitive.h

Copyright (c) 2025 IC Verimeter. All rights reserved.

Licensed under the MIT License.

See LICENSE file in the project root for full license information.

Description: Header file for SQLite primitive operations. Provides low-level database operations for SQLite database management, including connection handling, table operations, data manipulation, transaction control, and database maintenance.

Debug and Error Printing
Functions
dbg_print
void dbg_print(
const 
char 
*
prefix,
const 
char 
*
func_name,
const 
char 
*
format,
...
)

Prints debug messages with variable arguments.

Parameters
prefix
const char*

Prefix string for the debug message

func_name
const char*

Name of the function generating the debug message

format
const char*

Format string for the message

...

Variable arguments for the format string

const 
char 
*
prefix,

char 
*

char 
*

)

Prints error messages with variable arguments.

Parameters

format

...

Connection Management
Functions
sqlite_prim_open_database
sqlite3 *sqlite_prim_open_database(
const 
char 
*
db_path
)

Opens a SQLite database connection.

Parameters
db_path
const char*

Path to the SQLite database file

Returns

Pointer to the SQLite database connection, or NULL on failure

sqlite_prim_close_database
void sqlite_prim_close_database(
sqlite3 
*
db
)

Closes a SQLite database connection.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection to close

sqlite_prim_execute_query
int sqlite_prim_execute_query(
sqlite3 
*
db,
const 
char 
*
query
)

Executes a SQL query on the database.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection

query
const char*

SQL query string to execute

Returns

SQLite result code (SQLITE_OK on success)

Single Row/Column Operations
Functions
sqlite_prim_get_row
int sqlite_prim_get_row(
sqlite3 
*
db,
const 
char 
*
table,
int 
row_id,
char 
***
columns,
char 
***
values,
int 
*
col_count
)

Retrieves a single row from a table by ID.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection

table
const char*

Name of the table

row_id
int

ID of the row to retrieve

columns
char***

Pointer to store column names

values
char***

Pointer to store row values

col_count
int*

Pointer to store number of columns

Returns

SQLite result code (SQLITE_OK on success)

int sqlite_prim_insert_row(
sqlite3 
*
db,
const 
char 
*
table,
const 
char 
**
columns,
const 
char 
**
values,
int 
count
)

Inserts a new row into a table.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection

table
const char*

Name of the table

columns
const char**

Array of column names

values
const char**

Array of values to insert

count
int

Number of columns/values

Returns

SQLite result code (SQLITE_OK on success)

*
db,
const 
char 
*

int

)

Deletes a row from a table by ID.

Parameters

row_id

ID of the row to delete

Returns

sqlite_prim_get_rowid_by_column_value
int sqlite_prim_get_rowid_by_column_value(
sqlite3 
*
db,
const 
char 
*
table,
const 
char 
*
column,
const 
char 
*
value
)

Retrieves the first row ID that matches a specific column value.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection

table
const char*

Name of the table

column
const char*

Name of the column to search in

value
const char*

Value to search for

Returns

Row ID if found, -1 if not found or on error

sqlite_prim_get_cell_value
const char* sqlite_prim_get_cell_value(
sqlite3* 
db,
const 
char* 
table,
int 
row_id,
const 
char* 
column
)

Retrieves the value of a specific cell in a table.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection

table
const char*

Name of the table

row_id
int

ID of the row

column
const char*

Name of the column

Returns

The value of the cell as a string, or NULL on error or if not found. The caller is responsible for freeing the returned string.

sqlite_prim_get_row_by_rowid
int sqlite_prim_get_row_by_rowid(
sqlite3 
*
db,
const 
char 
*
table,
int 
row_id,
char 
***
values,
int 
col_count
)

Retrieves a row from a table by ID and returns it as an array.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection

table
const char*

Name of the table

row_id
int

ID of the row to retrieve

values
char***

Pointer to store the row values

col_count
int

Number of columns to retrieve

Returns

SQLite result code (SQLITE_OK on success)

sqlite_prim_table_exists
int sqlite_prim_table_exists(
sqlite3 
*
db,
const 
char 
*
table_name
)

Checks if a table exists in the database.

Parameters
db
sqlite3*

Pointer to the SQLite database connection

table_name
const char*

Name of the table to check

Returns

1 if table exists, 0 if not, negative on error
